forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. South southwest wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 54, with temperatures rising to around 57 overnight. South southwest wind 8 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfurls in Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of clouds blankets the sky, heralding the arrival of rain later in the day. The temperature stabilizes around a temperate 56 degrees, gradually dipping to a cooler 54 as the day progresses. A gentle breeze from the south-southwest whispers through the streets, already stirring a sense of anticipation as dark clouds loom overhead. The forecast hints at a 30% chance of rain, the city bracing for what could become a steady downpour by nightfall, with an impressive 90% likelihood of rain later. As dusk approaches, the chill lingers, urging residents to layer up for comfort; a warm sweater beneath a trusty raincoat would serve well against the escalating gusts, which could reach 31 mph.

From the vantage of those in the city, the atmosphere is thick with the promise of drizzle. The iconic Golden Gate Bridge often cloaked in fog appears as an ethereal silhouette, while the marine layer caresses the skyline, adding a touch of mystery to the familiar scene. It's advisable to embrace indoor pursuits today—the charm of a cozy café beckons, or perhaps a visit to a local gallery could offer an idyllic escape from the damp. Whether sampling a warm cup of coffee or perusing art amidst the clouds, one can find solace as San Francisco prepares to shake off this dreary cloaking for the promise of clearer skies.
